citation.article-title: Reclassification of marine Agrobacterium species: Proposals of Stappia stellulata gen. nov., comb. nov., Stappia aggregata sp. nov., nom. rev., Ruegeria atlantica gen. nov., comb. nov., Ruegeria gelatinovora comb. nov., Ruegeria algicola comb. nov., and Ahrensia kieliense gen. nov., sp. nov., nom. rev.
citation.source: The Journal of General and Applied Microbiology

p.s: Ahrensia (Ahrens.i.a. M.L. dim. ending -ia; M.L. fem. n. Ahrensia, honoring Ahrens, a German microbiologist, for his contribution to the taxonomy of marine species of Agrobacterium)
The cells are gram-negative rods 0.6 to 1.0 μm wide and 2.0 to 4.0 μm long.
They do not form spores and are motile by means of polar flagella.
The G+C content of the DNA is 48 mol%.
The type species is Ahrensia kieliense.
